image.altText: A man stares sombrely at the camera while reaching for his firefighting uniform.

props.synopsis: Country Fire Service volunteer Shaun Arnold says verbal abuse from the public is causing some volunteers to quit, a reality he does not want this fire danger season.

title.children: Country firies receiving 'a lot of abuse' from motorists plead for respect

image.altText: A silver knife attached to a grey spikey chain

props.synopsis: A man has been reported after police allegedly saw him "wearing a knife blade affixed to a chain around his neck" at a suburban Adelaide shopping centre.

title.children: 'A little bit of a weird one': Man reported for knife necklace at shopping centre

image.altText: A man without a shirt wearing a blue hat poses for a photo by a lake with kids.

props.synopsis: Olympic gold medal-winning swimmer Kyle Chalmers is inspiring young and aspiring athletes, and speaking about the importance of mental health.

title.children: Olympic gold medalist swaps coast for the outback on mental health tour

image.altText: person holding a dead baby dolphin

props.synopsis: Adelaide's stormwater network has been discharging high loads of sediment into the Gulf of St Vincent for decades, killing off seagrasses that are a key defence against blooms of the kind wreaking havoc in South Australia.

title.children: Is Adelaide's stormwater contributing to the algal bloom crisis?

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: South Australia police say several searches have been carried out on multiple premises in the Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands, including the administration offices in Umuwa.

title.children: Anti-corruption police raid APY Lands administration office

image.altText: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas at a media conference.

props.synopsis: South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas has not given up hope for Adelaide to potentially host the UN climate summit in the future, after Australia ceded the hosting rights for next year's event to Türkiye.

title.children: Hotels 'disappointed' by COP31 loss, but SA Premier suggests future bid

image.altText: Archie Ludowyke pictured representing the national academy

props.synopsis: Archie Ludowyke goes to his bedroom thinking he is not going to get his AFL dream realised, only to to hear an eruption from his living room as his name is called out by the Adelaide Crows.

title.children: Heartbroken draftee retreats to room in tears, misses moment he is picked

image.altText: Jasmine smiles while wearing a red jacket and black wide-brimmed hat with a cream underside

props.synopsis: A mother standing trial for the alleged criminal neglect and manslaughter of her daughter made the girl hit herself, locked her in an alarmed room and cut off most of her hair, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm, which may be distressing to readers.

title.children: Court hears from child who witnessed alleged abuse in manslaughter neglect case

image.altText: A woman with grey hair and a white rollneck sweater

props.synopsis: With 12 months still left of her term, a well-known South Australian mayor has been ousted by fellow councillors, but she has challenged them to offer a "legitimate reason" for her dismissal.

title.children: SA mayor removed by colleagues says she has done nothing wrong

image.altText: smelter factory external shots

props.synopsis: The manganese smelter in Tasmania has ore sitting untouched as Sanjeev Gupta turns to a Georgian company for a bailout, but an ASIC investigation looms.

title.children: 'Financially dire': Gupta lost Whyalla, Liberty Bell Bay may be next

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt stands between tall warehouse shelves, some are empty

props.synopsis: Creditors of disability employer Bedford are concerned they will not see money repaid, as the company prepares for sale to secure its future.

title.children: Bedford supplier says he has not 'received a cent' of $50,000 owed

image.altText: A farmer leans on a post in front of cows.

props.synopsis: South Australia's mining minister now has the power to extend mining leases, which farmers say makes the future of their land "uncertain".

title.children: Farmers say new mining laws create 'uncertainty' for their futures

image.altText: map shows Tropical Cyclone Fina making landfall near Cape Don, then passing between the Tiwi Islands and Darwin.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has declared a cyclone warning for Darwin as Cyclone Fina intensifies while tracking towards the Northern Territory capital.

title.children: BOM declares cyclone warning for Darwin as Fina tracks south-west

image.altText: Track map 7.33am 21-11 jpg

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has declared a cyclone warning for Darwin as Cyclone Fina intensifies while tracking towards the Northern Territory capital.

title.children: BOM declares cyclone warning for Darwin as Fina tracks south-west

image.altText: Ms Sloane in a blue blazer smiles as she talks into microphones at a media press conference with another woman behind her

props.synopsis: Former shadow health minister Ms Sloane was endorsed by Mr Speakman during a press conference announcing his resignation on Thursday afternoon and elected unopposed this morning.

title.children: New NSW opposition leader says 'we are ready for a fight'

image.altText: A composite of Xi Jinping and Sanae Takaichi

props.synopsis: China was already wary about Japan's new Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, a renowned Beijing hawk, before she weighed in on one of its most sensitive issues: Taiwan. Now it's unleashing economic pain.

title.children: Japan's PM said the quiet part out loud and unleashed Beijing's fury

image.altText: Malarndirri McCarthy looks at Scott Wilson. She is in focus.

props.synopsis: Malarndirri McCarthy says she understands states "will make their decisions in terms of elections" when it comes to rising incarceration rates, but that all leaders have a responsibility to examine to the "profound impacts" of policies.

title.children: Closing the Gap penalties still 'on the table', minister says

image.altText: A Virgin plane is seen through an airport terminal glass

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia and Qantas will ban the use of portable power banks from next month following a string of international incidents.

title.children: Virgin and Qantas to ban portable power banks after string of fires

image.altText: neo-nazis rally outside nsw parliament

props.synopsis: While federal and state governments, police and national security agencies grapple with how to respond to the National Socialist Network, several financial institutions and service providers have acted independently to restrict the flow of funds to the white supremacy group.

title.children: The high price of hate: Neo-Nazi figure's funds frozen, fundraising blocked

image.altText: Gif showing illustration of a house with household items and a fighter jet flying above.

props.synopsis: Take a tour around the house and see how everyday life is powered by critical minerals and why we will keep hearing so much about them.

title.children: How critical minerals power our daily lives from the moment we wake up

image.altText: A politician in a suit and tie, standing in front of a green sign with the Medicare logo.

props.synopsis: Medicare figures quietly published online show bulk-billing has not improved from a year ago, despite billions being tipped into the scheme. As out-of-pocket costs rise, GPs are delivering 10,000 fewer services every day compared to last year.

title.children: GP visits dropping by 10,000 a day, as cost pressures mount

image.altText: Paul Kelly, wearing headphones, smiles and sings into a microphone in studio performance

props.synopsis: Nearly 20 years on from his debut on triple j's long-running covers segment, Paul Kelly and his trusty band take on Australia's queen of pop for their Like A Version comeback.

title.children: Paul Kelly does it again with Kylie Minogue cover for Like A Version

image.altText: A white woman in a black linen vest and pants, walking out of a building, brown hair tied back.

props.synopsis: Building company director Jessica Buckley is the fourth person charged with fraud over an alleged $71 million Department of Defence contracts scandal.

title.children: Fourth person charged over alleged $71m Defence contracts fraud

image.altText: Green, pink, blue and multi-coloured sand products in transparent, white tubs on a white background.

props.synopsis: The online retail platform eBay Australia tells the ABC it uses artificial intelligence to stay informed of product recalls and to flag items that may be subject to a notice so they can be removed.

title.children: Coloured sand for sale on eBay removed days after asbestos recall

image.altText: A space station in orbit over a cloudy day on Earth.

props.synopsis: Moss has the potential to provide food for astronauts of the future, according to a study that exposed one of Earth's oldest plants to the extremes of space travel.

title.children: Moss survived nine months in space outside the ISS before returning to Earth

image.altText: Marm Fowler warming up for a Matildas match in 2025.

props.synopsis: Montpellier responds to racism allegations made by Matildas forward Mary Fowler, who says a teammate gave her bananas as a departing gift in 2022.

title.children: French football club denies Fowler's racism allegation

image.altText: A greater glider on a branch at nighttime

props.synopsis: New data points to the "systemic" under-reporting of greater glider dens within areas earmarked for logging in NSW, which scientists say could result in localised extinctions.

title.children: 'Absolute madness': Environment groups decry glider survey results

image.altText: People use fire extinguishers to put out a fire at COP30

props.synopsis: Officials say the fire, which erupted at one of the country exhibition pavilions, was brought under control in six minutes as security personnel ordered thousands of delegates in the sprawling building to go outside.

title.children: Thirteen people treated for smoke inhalation after fire at COP30 venue

image.altText: A worker installs electricity transmission components on an electricity pylon in Chuzhou.

props.synopsis: Countries across the globe are racing to rewire their electricity systems for a decarbonised future. In Australia, delays are mounting, along with doubts about whether it can meet goals on schedule.

title.children: Australia may just be one step ahead in the global race to rewire the world

image.altText: A young black man in a black superhero bodysuit looks determinedly into the distance.

props.synopsis: Boseman, who played T'Challa in Marvel's Black Panther, died in 2020 at the age of 43 from colon cancer, which had been diagnosed previously.

title.children: Chadwick Boseman awarded posthumous star on Hollywood Walk of Fame

image.altText: F1 driver walking his his garage, wearing a coat and racing suit

props.synopsis: Formula 1 championship rivals Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris were off the pace during the first practice session in Las Vegas, as Ferrari's Charles Leclerc topped the time sheets.

title.children: McLaren duo off the pace as Leclerc fastest in first Las Vegas practice

image.altText: two images, on the left is a close up of a woman smiling, on the right is a man and a woman doing thumbs up symbol

props.synopsis: Britain's National Crime Agency says criminal cash has been funnelled through a bank in Kyrgyzstan, then on to Russia.

title.children: Money laundering networks funding Russia's war efforts uncovered in Britain

image.altText: A mother giving her daughter pills out of a square bottle.

props.synopsis: As ADHD diagnoses rise, Australia's peak body for psychiatrists is calling for a national system to monitor and stop potential over-diagnosis of the condition.

title.children: Push for national approach to ADHD diagnoses as states forge different paths
